io.vertx.core

Interface CompositeFuture

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsyncResult<CompositeFuture>, Future<CompositeFuture>, Handler<AsyncResult<CompositeFuture>>

    public interface CompositeFuture
extends Future<CompositeFuture>
    The composite future wraps a list of futures, it is useful when several futures needs to be coordinated. The handlers set for the coordinated futures are overridden by the handler of the composite future.
    Author:
    Julien Viet

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.vertx.core.Future

        factory

      • all

        static <T1,T2> CompositeFuture all(Future<T1> f1,
                                   Future<T2> f2)
        Return a composite future, succeeded when all futures are succeeded, failed when any future is failed.

        The returned future fails as soon as one of f1 or f2 fails.

        Parameters:
        f1 - future
        f2 - future
        Returns:
        the composite future

      • join

        static <T1,T2> CompositeFuture join(Future<T1> f1,
                                    Future<T2> f2)
        Return a composite future, succeeded when all futures are succeeded, failed when any future is failed.

        It always wait until all its futures are completed and will not fail as soon as one of f1 or f2 fails.

        Parameters:
        f1 - future
        f2 - future
        Returns:
        the composite future

      • complete

        void complete()
        Set this instance as result. Any handler will be called, if there is one, and the future will be marked as completed.
        Specified by:
        complete in interface Future<CompositeFuture>

      • tryComplete

        boolean tryComplete()
        Try to set this instance as result. When it happens, any handler will be called, if there is one, and the future will be marked as completed.
        Specified by:
        tryComplete in interface Future<CompositeFuture>
        Returns:
        false when the future is already completed

      • list

        default <T> List<T> list()
        Returns:
